critique: This executive order designates certain government positions to be exempt from the Annual and Sick Leave Act of 1951 and delegates authority to the Chairman of the Civil Service Commission to make further designations. It appears to be an administrative action related to government personnel management. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It could be argued that delegating authority to the Civil Service Commission centralizes power at the federal level, but the effect is minimal. The order does not seem to have a direct impact on economic regulation or social inclusion. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
